meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I drew a cat on my notebook.
meanings.sent2: She drew a beautiful landscape during art class.
meanings.sent3: The teacher drew a smiley face on the test paper.
meanings.sent4: His words drew a clear picture of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The artist drew a masterpiece with just a pencil.

meanings.sent1: He drew the heavy box across the room.
meanings.sent2: The horse drew the carriage down the street.
meanings.sent3: The magnet drew the metal paperclips towards it.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind drew the kite high up in the sky.
meanings.sent5: She drew the curtains closed to block out the sunlight.

meanings.definition: to sketch or create a picture
meanings.sent1: The child drew a funny monster on the paper.
meanings.sent2: He drew a portrait of his friend for her birthday.
meanings.sent3: The artist drew a cartoon character with big eyes.
meanings.sent4: She drew a map to show the way to the park.
meanings.sent5: They drew a colorful rainbow in the sky with chalk.

meanings.sent1: The delicious smell of cookies drew me into the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The bright lights of the city drew tourists from all over.
meanings.sent3: The interesting book title drew her to pick it up and read.
meanings.sent4: The catchy tune drew a crowd to the street performer.
meanings.sent5: The promise of adventure drew them to explore the mysterious cave.

meanings.definition: to extract or obtain from a source
meanings.sent1: She drew water from the well to quench her thirst.
meanings.sent2: The detective drew information from the witness about the crime.
meanings.sent3: He drew inspiration from nature for his new painting.
meanings.sent4: The chef drew flavors from different cuisines to create a unique dish.
meanings.sent5: The researcher drew data from various studies to support the theory.
